View on GitHub

MailKit

MailKit: A cross-platform .NET mail-client library optimized for mobile.

Download this project as a .zip file Download this project as a tar.gz file
MailKit : MailKit Namespace

MailFolder Class

An abstract mail folder implementation.

Syntax

public abstract class MailFolder : IMailFolder, IEnumerable<MimeKit.MimeMessage>

Remarks

An abstract mail folder implementation.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Members

See Also: Inherited members from object.

Protected Constructors
MailFolder ()
 Initializes a new instance of the MailKit.MailFolder class.

Protected Fields

static readonly
SettableFlags MessageFlags . The bit mask of settable flags.

Public Properties

 AcceptedFlags MessageFlags . Get the accepted flags.
Access FolderAccess . Get the read/write access of the folder.
Attributes FolderAttributes . Get the folder attributes.
Count int . Get the total number of messages in the folder.
DirectorySeparator char . Get the directory separator.
Exists bool . Get a value indicating whether the folder exists.
FirstUnread int . Get the index of the first unread message in the folder.
FullName string . Get the full name of the folder.
HighestModSeq ulong . Get the highest mod-sequence value of all messages in the mailbox.
IsNamespace bool . Get whether or not the folder is a namespace folder.
[read-only]
abstract
IsOpen bool . Get a value indicating whether the folder is currently open.
IsSubscribed bool . Get a value indicating whether the folder is subscribed.
Name string . Get the name of the folder.
ParentFolder IMailFolder . Get the parent folder.
PermanentFlags MessageFlags . Get the permanent flags.
Recent int . Get the number of recently added messages in the folder.
SupportsModSeq bool . Get whether or not the folder supports mod-sequences.
[read-only]
abstract
SyncRoot object . Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the folder.
UidNext Nullable<UniqueId> . Get the UID that the folder will assign to the next message that is added.
UidValidity uint . Get the UID validity.
Unread int . Get the number of unread messages in the folder.

Open the folder using the requested folder access.
abstract
Open (FolderAccess, UniqueId, ulong, IList<UniqueId>, System.Threading.CancellationToken) : FolderAccess
Opens the folder using the requested folder access.
OpenAsync (FolderAccess, System.Threading.CancellationToken) : System.Threading.Tasks.Task<FolderAccess>
Asynchronously open the folder using the requested folder access.

Asynchronously opens the folder using the requested folder access.

override
ToString () : string
Returns a string that represents the current MailKit.MailFolder.
abstract
Unsubscribe (System.Threading.CancellationToken)
Unsubscribe from the folder.
UnsubscribeAsync (System.Threading.CancellationToken) : System.Threading.Tasks.Task
Asynchronously unsubscribe from the folder.

Protected Methods

 OnCountChanged ()
Raise the count changed event.
OnDeleted ()
Raise the deleted event.
OnMessageExpunged (MessageEventArgs)
Raise the message expunged event.
OnMessageFlagsChanged (MessageFlagsChangedEventArgs)
Raise the message flags changed event.
OnMessageLabelsChanged (MessageLabelsChangedEventArgs)
Raise the message labels changed event.
OnMessagesArrived (MessagesArrivedEventArgs)
Raise the messages arrived event.
OnMessagesVanished (MessagesVanishedEventArgs)
Raise the messages vanished event.
OnRecentChanged ()
Raise the recent changed event.
OnRenamed (string, string)
Raise the renamed event.
OnSubscribed ()
Raise the subscribed event.
OnUidValidityChanged ()
Raise the uid validity changed event.
OnUnsubscribed ()
Raise the unsubscribed event.

Public Events

 CountChanged Occurs when the message count changes.
Deleted Occurs when the folder is deleted.
MessageExpunged Occurs when a message is expunged from the folder.
MessageFlagsChanged Occurs when flags changed on a message.
MessageLabelsChanged Occurs when labels changed on a message.
MessagesArrived Occurs when new messages arrive in the folder.
MessagesVanished Occurs when a message vanishes from the folder.
RecentChanged Occurs when the recent message count changes.
Renamed Occurs when the folder is renamed.
Subscribed Occurs when the folder is subscribed.
UidValidityChanged Occurs when the UID validity changes.
Unsubscribed Occurs when the folder is unsubscribed.

Explicitly Implemented Interface Members

 IEnumerable.GetEnumerator Get an enumerator for the messages in the folder.

Member Details

MailFolder Constructor

Initializes a new instance of the MailKit.MailFolder class.

Syntax

protected MailFolder ()

Remarks

Initializes a new instance of the MailKit.MailFolder class.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AcceptedFlags Property

Get the accepted flags.

Syntax

public MessageFlags AcceptedFlags { get; protected set; }

Value

The accepted flags.

Remarks

The accepted flags are the message flags that will be accepted and persist for the current session. For the set of flags that will persist between sessions, see the MailFolder.PermanentFlags property.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Access Property

Get the read/write access of the folder.

Syntax

public FolderAccess Access { get; protected set; }

Value

The read/write access.

Remarks

Gets the read/write access of the folder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AddFlags Method

Add a set of flags to the specified message.

Syntax

public void AddFlags (UniqueId uid, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message.
flags
The message flags to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentException

uid is invalid.

-or-

No flags were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Adds a set of flags to the specified message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AddFlags Method

Add a set of flags to the specified messages.

Syntax

public virtual void AddFlags (IList<UniqueId> uids, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages.
flags
The message flags to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.

-or-

No flags were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Adds a set of flags to the specified messages.

Requirements

Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AddFlags Method

Add a set of flags to the specified messages.

Syntax

public virtual void AddFlags (IList<int> indexes, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

indexes
The indexes of the messages.
flags
The message flags to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException indexes is null.
ArgumentException

indexes is empty.

-or-

AddFlags Method

Add a set of flags to the specified message.

Syntax

public void AddFlags (UniqueId uid, MessageFlags flags, HashSet<string> userFlags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message.
flags
The message flags to add.
userFlags
A set of user-defined flags to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentException

uid is invalid.

-or-

No flags were specified.

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

AddFlags Method

Add a set of flags to the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Syntax

public virtual IList<UniqueId> AddFlags (IList<UniqueId> uids, ulong modseq, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
flags
The message flags to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The unique IDs of the messages that were not updated.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.

-or-

No flags were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.MailFolder does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Adds a set of flags to the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AddFlags Method

Add a set of flags to the specified messages.

Syntax

public abstract void AddFlags (IList<int> indexes, MessageFlags flags, HashSet<string> userFlags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

indexes
The indexes of the messages.
flags
The message flags to add.
userFlags
A set of user-defined flags to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException indexes is null.
ArgumentException

indexes is empty.

-or-

One or more of the indexes is invalid.

-or-

The UID of the message.
flags
The message flags to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.

Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AddLabels Method

Add a set of labels to the specified message.

Syntax

public void AddLabels (int index, IList<string> labels, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

index
The index of the message.
labels
The labels to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageLabelsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException labels is null.
ArgumentException

index is invalid.

-or-

No labels were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Adds a set of labels to the specified message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AddLabels Method

Add a set of labels to the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Syntax

public abstract IList<UniqueId> AddLabels (IList<UniqueId> uids, ulong modseq, IList<string> labels, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
labels
The labels to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageLabelsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The unique IDs of the messages that were not updated.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

uids is null.

-or-

labels is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.

-or-

No labels were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.MailFolder does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Adds a set of labels to the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AddLabelsAsync Method

Asynchronously add a set of labels to the specified message.

Syntax

public System.Threading.Tasks.Task AddLabelsAsync (UniqueId uid, IList<string> labels, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message.
labels
The labels to add.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageLabelsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An asynchronous task context.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException labels is null.
ArgumentException

uid is invalid.

-or-

No labels were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously adds a set of labels to the specified message.

Requirements

Append Method

Append the specified message to the folder.

Syntax

public virtual Nullable<UniqueId> Append (MimeKit.MimeMessage message, MessageFlags flags, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

message
The message.
flags
The message flags.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UID of the appended message, if available; otherwise, null.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException message is null.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Appends the specified message to the folder and returns the UniqueId assigned to the message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Append Method

Append the specified messages to the folder.

Syntax

public virtual IList<UniqueId> Append (IList<MimeKit.MimeMessage> messages, IList<MessageFlags> flags, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

messages
The array of messages to append to the folder.
flags
The message flags to use for each message.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UIDs of the appended messages, if available; otherwise an empty array.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

messages is null.

-or-

flags is null.
ArgumentException

One or more of the messages is null.

-or-

The number of messages does not match the number of flags.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Appends the specified messages to the folder and returns the UniqueIds assigned to the messages.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Append Method

Append the specified message to the folder.

Syntax

public abstract Nullable<UniqueId> Append (MimeKit.FormatOptions options, MimeKit.MimeMessage message, MessageFlags flags, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

options
The formatting options.
message
The message.
flags
The message flags.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UID of the appended message, if available; otherwise, null.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

options is null.

-or-

message is null.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

Internationalized formatting was requested but has not been enabled.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
NotSupportedException Internationalized formatting was requested but is not supported by the server.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Appends the specified message to the folder and returns the UniqueId assigned to the message.

Parameters

options
The formatting options.
messages
The array of messages to append to the folder.

The message flags to use for each message.

The cancellation token.

The UIDs of the appended messages, if available; otherwise an empty array.

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

Append Method

Append the specified message to the folder.

Syntax

public virtual Nullable<UniqueId> Append (MimeKit.MimeMessage message, MessageFlags flags, DateTimeOffset date, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

message
The message.
flags
The message flags.
date
The received date of the message.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UID of the appended message, if available; otherwise, null.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException message is null.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Appends the specified message to the folder and returns the UniqueId assigned to the message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Append Method

Append the specified messages to the folder.

Syntax

public virtual IList<UniqueId> Append (IList<MimeKit.MimeMessage> messages, IList<MessageFlags> flags, IList<DateTimeOffset> dates, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

messages
The array of messages to append to the folder.
flags
The message flags to use for each of the messages.
dates
The received dates to use for each of the messages.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UIDs of the appended messages, if available; otherwise an empty array.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

messages is null.

-or-

flags is null.

-or-

dates is null.
ArgumentException

One or more of the messages is null.

-or-

The number of messages, flags, and dates do not match.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Appends the specified messages to the folder and returns the UniqueIds assigned to the messages.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

ArgumentNullException message is null.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously appends the specified message to the folder and returns the UniqueId assigned to the message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AppendAsync Method

Asynchronously append the specified messages to the folder.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<IList<UniqueId>> AppendAsync (IList<MimeKit.MimeMessage> messages, IList<MessageFlags> flags, IList<DateTimeOffset> dates, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

messages
The array of messages to append to the folder.
flags
The message flags to use for each of the messages.
dates
The received dates to use for each of the messages.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UIDs of the appended messages, if available; otherwise an empty array.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

messages is null.

-or-

flags is null.

-or-

dates is null.
ArgumentException

One or more of the messages is null.

-or-

The number of messages, flags, and dates do not match.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously appends the specified messages to the folder and returns the UniqueIds assigned to the messages.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

AppendAsync Method

Asynchronously append the specified message to the folder.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Nullable<UniqueId>> AppendAsync (MimeKit.FormatOptions options, MimeKit.MimeMessage message, MessageFlags flags, DateTimeOffset date, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

options
The formatting options.
message
The message.
flags
The message flags.
date
The received date of the message.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UID of the appended message, if available; otherwise, null.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

options is null.

-or-

message is null.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

Internationalized formatting was requested but has not been enabled.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
NotSupportedException Internationalized formatting was requested but is not supported by the server.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously appends the specified message to the folder and returns the UniqueId assigned to the message.

CopyTo Method

Copy the specified message to the destination folder.

Syntax

public virtual Nullable<UniqueId> CopyTo (UniqueId uid, IMailFolder destination, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message to copy.
destination
The destination folder.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UID of the message in the destination folder, if available; otherwise, null.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException destination is null.
ArgumentException

uid is invalid.

-or-

The destination folder does not belong to the MailKit.IMailStore.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support the UIDPLUS extension.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Copies the specified message to the destination folder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Count Property

Get the total number of messages in the folder.

Syntax

public int Count { get; protected set; }

Value

The total number of messages.

Remarks

Gets the total number of messages in the folder.

Note: This value will only be set after calling MailFolder.Status(StatusItems, System.Threading.CancellationToken) with StatusItems.Count or by opening the folder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

CountChanged Event

Occurs when the message count changes.

Syntax

public event EventHandler<EventArgs> CountChanged

Remarks

The MailFolder.CountChanged event is emitted whenever the MailFolder.Count value changes.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Create Method

Create a new subfolder with the given name.

Syntax

public abstract IMailFolder Create (string name, bool isMessageFolder, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

name
The name of the folder to create.
isMessageFolder
true if the folder will be used to contain messages; otherwise false.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The created folder.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException name is null.
ArgumentException name is empty.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The MailFolder.DirectorySeparator is nil, and thus child folders cannot be created.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Creates a new subfolder with the given name.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

name
The name of the folder to create.
isMessageFolder
true if the folder will be used to contain messages; otherwise false.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The created folder.

Exceptions

Type Reason

ArgumentException name is empty.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The MailFolder.DirectorySeparator is nil, and thus child folders cannot be created.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Delete Method

Delete the folder.

Syntax

public abstract void Delete (System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The folder cannot be deleted (it is either a namespace or the Inbox).
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Deletes the folder.

Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The folder cannot be deleted (it is either a namespace or the Inbox).

Syntax

public bool Exists { get; protected set; }

Value

true if the folder exists; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Expunge Method

Expunge the folder, permanently removing all messages marked for deletion.

Syntax

public abstract void Expunge (System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Normally, an MailFolder.MessageExpunged event will be emitted for each message that is expunged. However, if the mail store supports the quick resynchronization feature and it has been enabled via the MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken) method, then the MailFolder.MessagesVanished event will be emitted rather than the MailFolder.MessageExpunged event.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Expunge Method

Expunge the specified uids, permanently removing them from the folder.

Syntax

public abstract void Expunge (IList<UniqueId> uids, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The message uids.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Normally, an MailFolder.MessageExpunged event will be emitted for each message that is expunged. However, if the mail store supports the quick resynchronization feature and it has been enabled via the MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken) method, then the MailFolder.MessagesVanished event will be emitted rather than the MailFolder.MessageExpunged event.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Normally, an MailFolder.MessageExpunged event will be emitted for each message that is expunged. However, if the mail store supports the quick resynchronization feature and it has been enabled via the MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken) method, then the MailFolder.MessagesVanished event will be emitted rather than the MailFolder.MessageExpunged event.

ExpungeAsync Method

Asynchronously expunge the specified uids, permanently removing them from the folder.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task ExpungeAsync (IList<UniqueId> uids, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The message uids.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An asynchronous task context.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Normally, an MailFolder.MessageExpunged event will be emitted for each message that is expunged. However, if the mail store supports the quick resynchronization feature and it has been enabled via the MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken) method, then the MailFolder.MessagesVanished event will be emitted rather than the MailFolder.MessageExpunged event.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Fetch Method

Fetch the message summaries for the specified message UIDs.

Parameters

uids
The UIDs.
items
The message summary items to fetch.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An enumeration of summaries for the requested messages.

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.

Parameters

uids
The UIDs.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
items
The message summary items to fetch.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An enumeration of summaries for the requested messages.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentOutOfRangeException items is empty.
ArgumentException One or more of the uids is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.IMailStore does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

If the mail store supports quick resynchronization and the application has enabled this feature via MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken), then this method will emit MailFolder.MessagesVanished events for messages that have vanished since the specified mod-sequence value.

Requirements

Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

uids
The UIDs.
items
The message summary items to fetch.
fields
The desired header fields.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An enumeration of summaries for the requested messages.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

uids is null.

-or-

fields is null.
ArgumentException

One or more of the uids is invalid.

-or-

fields is empty.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously fetches the message summaries for the specified message UIDs.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

FetchAsync Method

Asynchronously fetch the message summaries for the specified message UIDs that have a higher mod-sequence value than the one specified.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<IList<IMessageSummary>> FetchAsync (IList<UniqueId> uids, ulong modseq, MessageSummaryItems items, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
items
The message summary items to fetch.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An enumeration of summaries for the requested messages.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentOutOfRangeException items is empty.
ArgumentException One or more of the uids is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.IMailStore does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

If the mail store supports quick resynchronization and the application has enabled this feature via MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken), then this method will emit MailFolder.MessagesVanished events for messages that have vanished since the specified mod-sequence value.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

FirstUnread Property

Get the index of the first unread message in the folder.

Syntax

public int FirstUnread { get; protected set; }

Value

The index of the first unread message.

Remarks

This value will only be set after the folder has been opened.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

FullName Property

Get the full name of the folder.

Syntax

public string FullName { get; protected set; }

Value

The full name of the folder.

Remarks

This is the equivalent of the full path of a file on a file system.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Syntax

uid
The UID of the message.
part
The body part.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

The body part.

Type Reason

part

true if only the headers should be downloaded; otherwise, false>

GetBodyPartAsync Method

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<MimeKit.MimeEntity> GetBodyPartAsync (UniqueId uid, BodyPart part, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

The UID of the message.
part
The body part.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The body part.

Exceptions

Type Reason

ArgumentException uid is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously gets the specified body part.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

GetQuota Method

Get the quota information for the folder.

Syntax

public abstract FolderQuota GetQuota (System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The folder quota.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support quotas.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Gets the quota information for the folder.

To determine if a quotas are supported, check the IMailStore.SupportsQuotas property.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

GetStream Method

Get a substream of the specified message.

Syntax

public abstract System.IO.Stream GetStream (UniqueId uid, int offset, int count, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message.
offset
The starting offset of the first desired byte.
count
The number of bytes desired.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The stream.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentException uid is invalid.
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

offset is negative.

-or-

count is negative.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Gets a substream of the message. If the starting offset is beyond the end of the message, an empty stream is returned. If the number of bytes desired extends beyond the end of the message, a truncated stream will be returned.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

GetStream Method

Parameters

index
The index of the message.

count

The UID of the message.
part
The desired body part.

GetSubfolder Method

Get the specified subfolder.

Syntax

public abstract IMailFolder GetSubfolder (string name, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

name
The name of the subfolder.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The subfolder.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException name is null.
ArgumentException name is either an empty string or contains the MailFolder.DirectorySeparator.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.FolderNotFoundException The requested folder could not be found.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Gets the specified subfolder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.

MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

MoveTo Method

Move the specified message to the destination folder.

Syntax

public virtual Nullable<UniqueId> MoveTo (UniqueId uid, IMailFolder destination, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message to move.
destination
The destination folder.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UID of the message in the destination folder, if available; otherwise, null.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException destination is null.
ArgumentException

uid is invalid.

-or-

The destination folder does not belong to the MailKit.IMailStore.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support the UIDPLUS extension.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Moves the specified message to the destination folder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

MoveTo Method

Move the specified messages to the destination folder.

Syntax

public abstract IList<UniqueId> MoveTo (IList<UniqueId> uids, IMailFolder destination, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages to move.
destination
The destination folder.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The UIDs of the messages in the destination folder, if available; otherwise an empty array.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

uids is null.

-or-

destination is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.

-or-

The destination folder does not belong to the MailKit.IMailStore.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Open Method

Open the folder using the requested folder access.

Syntax

public abstract FolderAccess Open (FolderAccess access, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

access
The requested folder access.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The MailKit.FolderAccess state of the folder.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentOutOfRangeException access is not a valid value.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Opens the folder using the requested folder access.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Open Method

Opens the folder using the requested folder access.

Syntax

public abstract FolderAccess Open (FolderAccess access, UniqueId uidValidity, ulong highestModSeq, IList<UniqueId> uids, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

access
The requested folder access.
uidValidity
The last known MailFolder.UidValidity value.
highestModSeq
The last known MailFolder.HighestModSeq value.
uids
The last known list of unique message identifiers.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The MailKit.FolderAccess state of the folder.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentOutOfRangeException access is not a valid value.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The quick resynchronization feature has not been enabled.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support the quick resynchronization feature.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

This variant of the MailFolder.Open(FolderAccess, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method is meant for quick resynchronization of the folder. Before calling this method, the MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken) method MUST be called.

You should also make sure to add listeners to the MailFolder.MessagesVanished and MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events to get notifications of changes since the last time the folder was opened.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

OpenAsync Method

Asynchronously open the folder using the requested folder access.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<FolderAccess> OpenAsync (FolderAccess access, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

access
The requested folder access.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The MailKit.FolderAccess state of the folder.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentOutOfRangeException access is not a valid value.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously opens the folder using the requested folder access.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

OpenAsync Method

Asynchronously opens the folder using the requested folder access.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<FolderAccess> OpenAsync (FolderAccess access, UniqueId uidValidity, ulong highestModSeq, IList<UniqueId> uids, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

access
The requested folder access.
uidValidity
The last known MailFolder.UidValidity value.
highestModSeq
The last known MailFolder.HighestModSeq value.
uids
The last known list of unique message identifiers.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The MailKit.FolderAccess state of the folder.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentOutOfRangeException access is not a valid value.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The quick resynchronization feature has not been enabled.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support the quick resynchronization feature.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

This variant of the MailFolder.OpenAsync(FolderAccess, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method is meant for quick resynchronization of the folder. Before calling this method, the MailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken) method MUST be called.

You should also make sure to add listeners to the MailFolder.MessagesVanished and MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events to get notifications of changes since the last time the folder was opened.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

ParentFolder Property

Get the parent folder.

Syntax

public IMailFolder ParentFolder { get; protected set; }

Value

The parent folder.

Remarks

Root-level folders do not have a parent folder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

PermanentFlags Property

Get the permanent flags.

Syntax

public MessageFlags PermanentFlags { get; protected set; }

Value

The permanent flags.

Remarks

The permanent flags are the message flags that will persist between sessions.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Recent Property

Get the number of recently added messages in the folder.

Syntax

public int Recent { get; protected set; }

Value

The number of recently added messages.

Remarks

Gets the number of recently delivered messages in the folder.

Note: This value will only be set after calling MailFolder.Status(StatusItems, System.Threading.CancellationToken) with StatusItems.Recent or by opening the folder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

RecentChanged Event

Occurs when the recent message count changes.

Syntax

public event EventHandler<EventArgs> RecentChanged

Remarks

The MailFolder.RecentChanged event is emitted whenever the MailFolder.Recent value changes.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

RemoveFlags Method

Remove a set of flags from the specified message.

Syntax

public void RemoveFlags (UniqueId uid, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UIDs of the message.
flags
The message flags to remove.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentException

uid is invalid.

-or-

No flags were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Removes a set of flags from the specified message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

RemoveFlags Method

Remove a set of flags from the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Syntax

public virtual IList<UniqueId> RemoveFlags (IList<UniqueId> uids, ulong modseq, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
flags
The message flags to remove.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The unique IDs of the messages that were not updated.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.

-or-

No flags were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.MailFolder does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Parameters

The indexes of the messages.
flags
The message flags to remove.
userFlags

silent

The UID of the message.
flags
The message flags to remove.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken

Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

RemoveLabels Method

Remove a set of labels from the specified message.

Syntax

public void RemoveLabels (int index, IList<string> labels, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

index
The index of the message.
labels
The labels to remove.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageLabelsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException labels is null.
ArgumentException

index is invalid.

-or-

No labels were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Removes a set of labels from the specified message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

RemoveLabels Method

Remove a set of labels from the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Syntax

public abstract IList<UniqueId> RemoveLabels (IList<UniqueId> uids, ulong modseq, IList<string> labels, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
labels
The labels to remove.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageLabelsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The unique IDs of the messages that were not updated.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

uids is null.

-or-

labels is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.

-or-

No labels were specified.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.MailFolder does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Removes a set of labels from the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Syntax

public System.Threading.Tasks.Task RemoveLabelsAsync (UniqueId uid, IList<string> labels, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message.
labels
The labels to remove.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageLabelsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An asynchronous task context.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException labels is null.
ArgumentException

uid is invalid.

-or-

No labels were specified.

InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

Rename Method

Rename the folder.

Syntax

public abstract void Rename (IMailFolder parent, string name, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

parent
The new parent folder.
name
The new name of the folder.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

parent is null.

-or-

name is null.
ArgumentException

parent does not belong to the MailKit.IMailStore.

-or-

name is not a legal folder name.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The folder cannot be renamed (it is either a namespace or the Inbox).
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Renames the folder.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

RenameAsync Method

Asynchronously rename the folder.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task RenameAsync (IMailFolder parent, string name, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

parent
The new parent folder.
name
The new name of the folder.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An asynchronous task context.

Exceptions

Type Reason

parent is null.

-or-

name is null.
ArgumentException

parent does not belong to the MailKit.IMailStore.

-or-

name is not a legal folder name.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is either not connected or not authenticated.

-or-

The folder cannot be renamed (it is either a namespace or the Inbox).
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Requirements

Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Renamed Event

Occurs when the folder is renamed.

Syntax

public event EventHandler<FolderRenamedEventArgs> Renamed

Remarks

The MailFolder.Renamed event is emitted when the folder is renamed.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Search Method

Search the folder for messages matching the specified query.

Syntax

public abstract IList<UniqueId> Search (MailKit.Search.SearchQuery query, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

query
The search query.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An array of matching UIDs.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException query is null.
NotSupportedException One or more search terms in the query are not supported by the mail store.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

The returned array of unique identifiers can be used with IMailFolder.GetMessage(UniqueId, System.Threading.CancellationToken).

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Search Method

Search the folder for messages matching the specified query, returning them in the preferred sort order.

Syntax

public abstract IList<UniqueId> Search (MailKit.Search.SearchQuery query, IList<MailKit.Search.OrderBy> orderBy, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

query
The search query.
orderBy
The sort order.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An array of matching UIDs in the specified sort order.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

query is null.

-or-

orderBy is null.
ArgumentException orderBy is empty.
NotSupportedException

One or more search terms in the query are not supported by the mail store.

-or-

The server does not support the SORT extension.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

The returned array of unique identifiers will be sorted in the preferred order and can be used with IMailFolder.GetMessage(UniqueId, System.Threading.CancellationToken).

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Search Method

Search the subset of UIDs in the folder for messages matching the specified query.

Syntax

public abstract IList<UniqueId> Search (IList<UniqueId> uids, MailKit.Search.SearchQuery query, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The subset of UIDs
query
The search query.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An array of matching UIDs in the specified sort order.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException

uids is null.

-or-

query is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.

ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.

SetFlags Method

Set the flags of the specified message.

Syntax

public void SetFlags (UniqueId uid, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uid
The UIDs of the message.
flags
The message flags to set.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentException uid is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Sets the flags of the specified message.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

SetFlags Method

Set the flags of the specified messages.

Syntax

public virtual void SetFlags (IList<UniqueId> uids, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages.
flags
The message flags to set.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

SetFlags Method

Set the flags of the specified messages.

Syntax

public virtual void SetFlags (IList<int> indexes, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

indexes
The indexes of the messages.
flags
The message flags to set.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException indexes is null.
ArgumentException

indexes is empty.

-or-

One or more of the indexes is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

SetFlags Method

Set the flags of the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Syntax

public virtual IList<UniqueId> SetFlags (IList<UniqueId> uids, ulong modseq, MessageFlags flags, bool silent, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

uids
The UIDs of the messages.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
flags
The message flags to set.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The unique IDs of the messages that were not updated.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException uids is null.
ArgumentException

uids is empty.

-or-

One or more of the uids is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.MailFolder does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Sets the flags of the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Requirements

Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Syntax

Parameters

uid
The UID of the message.
flags
The message flags to set.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An asynchronous task context.

Type Reason

-or-

indexes
The indexes of the messages.
modseq
The mod-sequence value.
flags
The message flags to set.
userFlags
A set of user-defined flags to set.
silent
If set to true, no MailFolder.MessageFlagsChanged events will be emitted.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The indexes of the messages that were not updated.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ArgumentNullException indexes is null.
ArgumentException

indexes is empty.

-or-

One or more of the indexes is invalid.
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open in read-write mode.
NotSupportedException The MailKit.MailFolder does not support mod-sequences.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Asynchronously sets the flags of the specified messages only if their mod-sequence value is less than the specified value.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

SetQuota Method

Set the quota limits for the folder.

Syntax

public abstract FolderQuota SetQuota (Nullable<uint> messageLimit, Nullable<uint> storageLimit, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

messageLimit
If not null, sets the maximum number of messages to allow.
storageLimit
If not null, sets the maximum storage size (in kilobytes).
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

The updated folder quota.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support quotas.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Sets the quota limits for the folder.

To determine if a quotas are supported, check the IMailStore.SupportsQuotas property.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

SettableFlags Field

The bit mask of settable flags.

Syntax

protected static readonly MessageFlags SettableFlags

Remarks

Only flags in list of settable flags may be set on a message by the client.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Status Method

Update the values of the specified items.

Syntax

public abstract void Status (StatusItems items, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

items
The items to update.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support the STATUS command.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Updates the values of the specified items.

The MailFolder.Status(StatusItems, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method MUST NOT be used on a folder that is already in the opened state. Instead, other ways of getting the desired information should be used.

For example, a common use for the MailFolder.Status(StatusItems, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method is to get the number of unread messages in the folder. When the folder is open, however, it is possible to use the MailFolder.Search(MailKit.Search.SearchQuery, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method to query for the list of unread messages.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

StatusAsync Method

Asynchronously update the values of the specified items.

Syntax

public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task StatusAsync (StatusItems items, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken)

Parameters

items
The items to update.
cancellationToken
The cancellation token.

Returns

An asynchronous task context.

Exceptions

Type Reason
ObjectDisposedException The MailKit.IMailStore has been disposed.
InvalidOperationException

The MailKit.IMailStore is not connected.

-or-

The MailKit.IMailStore is not authenticated.

-or-

The folder is not currently open.
NotSupportedException The mail store does not support the STATUS command.
OperationCanceledException The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
System.IO.IOException An I/O error occurred.
MailKit.ProtocolException The server's response contained unexpected tokens.
MailKit.CommandException The command failed.

Remarks

Updates the values of the specified items.

The MailFolder.Status(StatusItems, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method MUST NOT be used on a folder that is already in the opened state. Instead, other ways of getting the desired information should be used.

For example, a common use for the MailFolder.Status(StatusItems, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method is to get the number of unread messages in the folder. When the folder is open, however, it is possible to use the MailFolder.Search(MailKit.Search.SearchQuery, System.Threading.CancellationToken) method to query for the list of unread messages.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

Subscribed Event

Occurs when the folder is subscribed.

Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

SupportsModSeq Property

Get whether or not the folder supports mod-sequences.

Syntax

public bool SupportsModSeq { get; protected set; }

Value

true if supports mod-sequences; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If mod-sequences are not supported by the folder, then all of the APIs that take a modseq argument will throw NotSupportedException and should not be used.

Requirements

Namespace: MailKit
Assembly: MailKit (in MailKit.dll)
Assembly Versions: 1.0.0.0

SyncRoot Property

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the folder.

Syntax

public abstract object SyncRoot { get; }

Value

The sync root.

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the folder.
